block.name: coex_bb_bt
block.comment: Bluetooth Coexistence registers for Baseband chip

register.name: COEX_BT_SW_RESET
register.comment: Write a 1 to reset BT Coexistence digital on BBIC.

register.name: COEX_BT_ALLOWED_ORIDE
register.comment: Software overrides for the WLAN/BT Coex radio enables. Forcing these bits on will allow BT/WLAN Tx/Rx activity to start. Shouldn't really be used!

register.name: COEX_BT_ASTX
register.comment: BT ASTX configuration.

register.name: COEX_BT_ASTX1
register.comment: BT ASTX configuration.

register.name: COEX_BT_ASTX_START_TIME
register.comment: BT ASTX Start Time (with respect to microsecond system time).

register.name: COEX_BT_ASTX_UPDATE
register.comment: BT ASTX control: Simply write a 1 to this register to refresh ASTX contents and advertise it, or write a 0 to invalidate ASTX.

register.name: COEX_BT_ASTX_STICKY_STATUS
register.comment: BT ASTX status register. Contents are cleared when a 1 is written to COEX_BT_ASTX_UPDATE.

register.name: COEX_BT_ASTX_DEFER_COUNT
register.comment: BT ASTX defer counter. An accumulative count showing the number of times BT ASTX has been deferred.

register.name: COEX_BT_ASTX_CLR_DEFER_COUNT
register.comment: BT ASTX defer count clear - write a 1 in order to clear COEX_BT_ASTX_DEFER_COUNT.

register.name: COEX_BT_ASRX
register.comment: BT ASRX configuration.

register.name: COEX_BT_ASRX1
register.comment: BT ASTX configuration.

register.name: COEX_BT_ASRX_START_TIME
register.comment: BT ASRX Start Time (with respect to microsecond system time).

register.name: COEX_BT_ASRX_UPDATE
register.comment: BT ASRX control: Simply write a 1 to this register to refresh ASRX contents and advertise it, or write a 0 to invalidate ASRX.

register.name: COEX_BT_ASRX_STICKY_STATUS
register.comment: BT ASRX status register. Contents are cleared when a 1 is written to COEX_BT_ASRX_UPDATE.

register.name: COEX_BT_ASRX_DEFER_COUNT
register.comment: BT ASRX defer counter. An accumulative count showing the number of times BT ASRX has been deferred.

register.name: COEX_BT_ASRX_CLR_DEFER_COUNT
register.comment: BT ASRX defer count clear - write a 1 in order to clear COEX_BT_ASRX_DEFER_COUNT.

block.name: coex_bb_wl_0
block.comment: WLAN Coexistence registers for Baseband chip

register.name: COEX_WL_SW_RESET_I0
register.comment: Set in order to force a software reset of the WL Coexistence digital.

register.name: COEX_WL_ALLOWED_ORIDE_I0
register.comment: Software overrides for the WLAN/BT Coex radio enables. Forcing these bits on will allow BT/WLAN Tx/Rx activity to start. Shouldn't really be used!

register.name: COEX_WL_DELAY_DEFERS_EN_I0
register.comment: When set to 1, the CDL defer is gated until the remote Activity Set is in progress.

register.name: COEX_WL_TRAN_CTRL_CFG_I0
register.comment: Coexistence Transition Control configuration.

register.name: COEX_WL_FEC_CFG_I0[0]
register.comment: 5G RF Switch Configurations

register.name: COEX_WL_FEC_CFG_I0[1]
register.comment: 5G RF Switch Configurations

register.name: COEX_WL_TX_ACK_PRIORITY_I0
register.comment: The WLAN priority to use for transmitted Acks.

register.name: COEX_WL_TX_DATA_DUR_OFFSET_I0
register.comment: An optional number of microseconds to add onto the duration of a transmitted Data frame. (should not be required).

register.name: COEX_WL_TX_ACK_DUR_OFFSET_I0
register.comment: An optional number of microseconds to add onto the duration of a transmitted Ack (should not be required).

register.name: COEX_WL_TX_MISC_CFG_I0
register.comment: Misc WLAN Tx configuration.

register.name: COEX_WL_TX_STICKY_STATUS_I0
register.comment: WLAN ASTX status register. Contents are cleared when the MAC Acc makes a new Tx request.

register.name: COEX_WL_TX_DEFER_COUNT_I0
register.comment: WLAN ASTX defer counter. An accumulative count showing the number of times WLAN ASTX has been deferred.

register.name: COEX_WL_TX_CLR_DEFER_COUNT_I0
register.comment: WLAN ASTX defer count clear - write a 1 in order to clear COEX_WL_ASTX_DEFER_COUNT.

register.name: COEX_WL_RX_LISTEN_DURATION_I0
register.comment: The advertised ASRX duration when WLAN is listening. ASRX is automatically updated when this time expires.

register.name: COEX_WL_RX_LISTEN_PRIORITY_I0
register.comment: The WLAN priority when WLAN is listening.

register.name: COEX_WL_RX_PHYACT_PRIORITY_I0
register.comment: The WLAN priority when the PHY is actively receiving (but Rx is not confirmed by MAC Acc).

register.name: COEX_WL_RX_MAC_PRIORITY_I0
register.comment: The WLAN priority when MAC Acc confirms Rx.

register.name: COEX_WL_RX_ACK_PRIORITY_I0
register.comment: The WLAN priority for Rx acknowledgements.

register.name: COEX_WL_RX_DATA_DUR_OFFSET_I0
register.comment: An optional number of microseconds to add onto the duration of a received Data frame. (should not be required).

register.name: COEX_WL_RX_ACK_DUR_OFFSET_I0
register.comment: An optional number of microseconds to add onto the duration of a received Ack. (should not be required).

register.name: COEX_WL_RX_MIN_ANT_SEL_I0
register.comment: Select minimum number of antenna(s) to use for Rx.

register.name: COEX_WL_RX_MISC_CFG_I0
register.comment: Misc WLAN Rx configuration

register.name: COEX_WL_RX_STICKY_STATUS_I0

register.name: PCH_ACK
register.comment: P-channel manager power down acknowledge. 1 = powered-down, 0 = powered-up.

register.comment: Controls the Sweeper modules in WLBT. Set to 1 to start a sweeper clean. Return to 0 once the ACK for that sweeper is set.

register.name: SWEEPER_STATUS
register.comment: Status from the Sweeper modules in WLBT. '1' in a field indicates Sweeper completion.

register.name: MILDRED_AP2WB_REQ
register.comment: Incoming requests from AP to WLBT.

register.name: MILDRED_WB2AP_ACK
register.comment: Outgoing acknowledgement from WLBT to AP.

register.name: CLK_GATE_OVR2
register.comment: Clock Gate overrides. Set to '1' to enable the clocks for each of the specified blocks.

register.name: WATCHDOG_ENABLE
register.comment: Writing '1' enables the watchdog regardless of its previous state and resets its state machine to WATCHDOG_STATUS_FSM_ENABLED.

register.name: WATCHDOG_DISABLE
register.comment: Writing the 3 disable codes in sequence to this register will disable the watchdog. Writing WATCHDOG_DEBUG_CODE3 instead of WATCHDOG_DISABLE_CODE3 will set the watchdog into debug mode. Each correct code written will advance the WATCHDOG_STATUS by 1 until it reaches 3. A status of 3 indicates that the watchdog has been disabled A status of 4 indicates that the watchdog is in debug mode. If an incorrect code is written at any time, the status will revert to 0 (enabled). The watchdog will not stop counting down until all three codes have been written correctly.

register.name: WATCHDOG_KICK
register.comment: Writing to this register causes the countdown value to be reset to the value stored in WATCHDOG_DELAY. WATCHDOG_DELAY is captured into the slow clock domain after a cycle or two. The register fields WATCHDOG_STATUS_KICK_PENDING and WATCHDOG_STATUS_SLOW_KICK_PENDING indicate if this register has already been written and an update is currently pending. Writing this register toggles a flag inside the watchdog logic so writing it a second time before the first has successfully propagated will clear the toggle and cancel the kick.

register.name: WATCHDOG_STATUS
register.comment: Watchdog status compound register.

register.name: QCH_FORCE_EN2
register.comment: Q-channel manager force clock enable

register.name: DRCG
register.comment: Dynamic Root Clock gating feature of SLSI blocks. Set to '1' to enable block clock gating. Otherwise the clocks will run all the time.

register.comment: Bits [ 7: 0] of PIO drive enable bus. These 8 PIO drive enable bits are bit-addressable to allow convenient switching for use with e.g. I2C.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_PIO_0700_WAKEUP_ENABLES
register.comment: This register enables the PIO[7:0] inputs individually to allow them to create a deep sleep wakeup event.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_PIO_0700_WAKEUP_INVERT
register.comment: This register inverts the PIO[7:0] inputs individually before feeding them into the deep sleep wakeup logic. A 1 on the resulting bit may cause a wakeup event.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS_PIO_0700_WAKEUP_STICKY
register.comment: This register returns a sticky version of the PIO[7:0] deep sleep wakeup activities. Clear the sticky activity flops by writing 1 to DEEP_SLEEP_WAKEUP_CLR_PIO.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_PIO_1508_WAKEUP_ENABLES
register.comment: This register enables the PIO[15:8] inputs individually to allow them to create a deep sleep wakeup event.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_PIO_1508_WAKEUP_INVERT
register.comment: This register inverts the PIO[15:8] inputs individually before feeding them into the deep sleep wakeup logic. A 1 on the resulting bit may cause a wakeup event.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS_PIO_1508_WAKEUP_STICKY
register.comment: This register returns a sticky version of the PIO[15:8] deep sleep wakeup activities. Clear the sticky activity flops by writing 1 to DEEP_SLEEP_WAKEUP_CLR_PIO.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_CMD

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_WAKEUP_ENABLES0

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS0
register.comment: This register indicates the currently-active deep sleep wakeup sources.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS_STICKY0
register.comment: This register returns a sticky version of DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS, recording all wakeup events since it was last cleared. Bits are enumerated as DEEP_SLEEP_WAKEUP.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_WAKEUP_ENABLES1

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS1
register.comment: This register indicates the currently-active deep sleep wakeup sources.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS_STICKY1

register.name: PHY_DEBUG_SELECT[0]
register.comment: Controls bits 31:16 and 15:0 of the debug multiplexers' output. The multiplexers are organized hierarchically, one nibble controlling multiplexer at each hierarchical level. Selecting 0 for any of the multiplexer positions disables the debug output, setting PHY_DEBUG_SELECT_0 for both bus segments to zero disables the clock to any debug logic.

register.name: PHY_DEBUG_SELECT[1]
register.comment: Controls bits 31:16 and 15:0 of the debug multiplexers' output. The multiplexers are organized hierarchically, one nibble controlling multiplexer at each hierarchical level. Selecting 0 for any of the multiplexer positions disables the debug output, setting PHY_DEBUG_SELECT_0 for both bus segments to zero disables the clock to any debug logic.

register.name: PHY_DEBUG_READ
register.comment: Reads the instantaneous value of the output of the debug multiplexers.

register.name: CLKGEN_DEBUG_SELECT_I0
register.comment: This register selects which of a variety of debug buses are driven out of the block

register.name: CLKGEN_TIMER_FAST_STATUS_I0
register.comment: This read-only register contains the current value of the fast timer. It is used to set time changes on PIOs to implement serial buses. The value is in units of 12.5ns (80MHz) and it is free running all the time that the CLKGEN_TIMER_FAST_EN bit in CLKGEN_TIMER_ENABLES is set.

register.name: WL_CLKGEN_ENABLES_I0
register.comment: This register enables many of the core clocks on the chip. When a corresponding bit is set, the clock is enabled, regardless of any corresponding clock request

register.name: CLKGEN_PP_ENABLES_I0
register.comment: This register enables processor platform clocks. When a corresponding bit is set, the clock is enabled, regardless of any corresponding clock request

register.name: CLKGEN_WL_ENABLES_I0
register.comment: This register is logically an extension of CLKGEN_ENABLES, but contains bits associated with wireless LAN specific clocks

register.name: CLKGEN_BB_ENABLES_I0
register.comment: This register is logically an extension of CLKGEN_ENABLES, but contains bits associated with wireless LAN baseband specific clocks. Forcing the clocks ON is not recommended for power saving.

register.name: CLKGEN_LDPC_ENABLES_I0
register.comment: This register is logically an extension of CLKGEN_ENABLES, but contains bits associated with LDPC specific clocks. Forcing the clocks ON is not recommended for power saving.

register.name: CLKGEN_CLKMAC_SLEEP_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: This register selects which of the clock requests and the Mac Activity input are capable of forcing the Clk20MRadio clock to be active. This could be useful to software in controlling sleep modes for the Mac Accelerator.

register.name: CLKGEN_STATUS_I0
register.comment: This register returns the instantaneous status of the various deep sleep wakeup sources, along with the deep sleep mode bit and the status of the slow clock

register.name: CLKGEN_CLK_REQ_ENABLES_I0
register.comment: This register enables clock requests to have an effect. If these bits are cleared, the clock request from the corresponding block is ignored

register.name: CLKGEN_BB_CLK_REQ_ENABLES_I0
register.comment: This register enables clock requests to have an effect. If these bits are cleared, the clock request from the corresponding block is ignored

register.name: CLKGEN_LDPC_CLK_REQ_ENABLES_I0
register.comment: This register enables clock requests to have an effect. If these bits are cleared, the clock request from the corresponding block is ignored

register.name: CLKGEN_CLK_REQ_STATUS_I0
register.comment: This register allows the firmware to see the instantaneous state of the clock request lines from the various subsystems to assist in deciding whether the hardware is really idle or just pausing briefly

register.name: CLKGEN_BB_CLK_REQ_STATUS_I0
register.comment: This register allows the firmware to see the instantaneous state of the clock request lines from the various subsystems to assist in deciding whether the hardware is really idle or just pausing briefly

register.name: CLKGEN_LDPC_CLK_REQ_STATUS_I0
register.comment: This register allows the firmware to see the instantaneous state of the clock request lines from the various subsystems to assist in deciding whether the hardware is really idle or just pausing briefly

register.name: CLKGEN_VITERBI_PRESCALE_CFG_I0
register.comment: Register to set 480MHz clock prescaling before it is used to create Viterbi clock. Prescaled clock would be 480, 240, 120 and 80 MHz when set to 1, 2, 3 and 4 respectfully. Recommended settings are SISO 1, 1, 2 and 4 for 80+80, 80, 40 and 20 MHz operating bandwidth; MIMO 1, 1, 3, 4 for 80+80, 80, 40 and 20 MHz operating bandwidth. NOTE: If HT-GF LDPC 20 MHz reception capability is advertised configure to 1.

register.name: CLKGEN_VITERBI_SCALE_CFG_I0
register.comment: Register to divide prescaled 480MHz clock to create Viterbi clock. The scaling value applied is (Register Value + 1)/8. Recommended settings are SISO 5, 5, 5 and 7 for 80+80, 80, 40 and 20 MHz operating bandwidth; MIMO 7, 7, 7, 6 for 80+80, 80, 40 and 20 MHz operating bandwidth. NOTE: If HT-GF LDPC 20 MHz reception capability is advertised configure to 4.

register.name: DFE_RX_CONFIG[0]
register.comment: Rx configuration bits

register.name: DFE_RX_STATUS[0]
register.comment: Rx antenna status and latency measurements

register.name: DFE_RX_LNA_PHASE_COMP_CONFIG1[0]
register.comment: Configuration for LNA phase compensation - WL LNA.

register.name: DFE_RX_LNA_PHASE_COMP_CONFIG2[0]
register.comment: Configuration for LNA phase compensation - WL LNA.

register.name: DFE_RX_NOTCH_CONFIG[0]
register.comment: This register configures the two notch filters in each of the receive chains. The lower 5 bits configure the OFDM filter and the next 5 bits the CCK filter. The MSB enables the notch filter in front of the rx_ctrl module

register.name: DFE_RX_NOTCHA_STATUS[0]
register.comment: Rx status of notch filter A (OFDM) in each of the receive chain.

register.name: DFE_RX_NOTCHB_STATUS[0]
register.comment: Rx status of notch filter B (CCK) in each of the receive chain.

register.name: DFE_RX_NOTCH_PRELOAD[0]
register.comment: This is the value loaded into the memory element of the notch filters if requested

register.name: DFE_SIGANAL_CONFIG[0]
register.comment: This register configures the signal analyser

register.name: DFE_SIGANAL_FREQ[0]
register.comment: This sets the frequencies of the tones used by the signal analyser. The value for a given frequency can be found by multiplying by 65_536 and dividing by 160_000_000. This sets the frequency of the tone used by the signal analyser.

register.name: DFE_RX_COMP_CONFIG1[0]
register.comment: This register controls phase and magnitude compensation for the receive signals in the first receive chain, and has a bit which enables frequency compensation for both receive chains.

register.name: DFE_RX_COMP_CONFIG2[0]
register.comment: Configuration parameters for the averaging block in the Rx IQ Compensation measurement block

register.name: DFE_RX_COMP_DC[0]
register.comment: This register controls the ADC DC level compensation parameters

register.name: DFE_RX_COMP_DELAY_CONFIG[0]
register.comment: This register controls the receiver delay compensation parameters

register.name: DFE_RX_COMP_PHASE_CONFIG[0]
register.comment: Configuration for receiver phase compensation

register.name: DFE_RX_COMP_AMPL_CONFIG[0]
register.comment: Configuration for receiver amplitude compensation

register.name: DFE_RX_COMP_AUTO_COEFFS[0]
register.comment: The current values of automatic I/Q trims can be read back from this register. The trim values are in sign/magnitude format. The phase trim is in the upper 8 bits and the amplitude trim in the lower 8 bits of this register. By setting the DFE_RX_COMP_LUT_READ_EN bit in the DFE_RX_COMP_CONFIG1 register, entries in the compensation table can also be read.

register.name: DFE_RX_PHASE_COMP_LUT_STATUS[0]
register.comment: This register reads the current phase compensation LUT entry

register.name: DFE_RX_AMPL_COMP_LUT_STATUS[0]
register.comment: This register reads the current amplitude compensation LUT entry

register.name: DFE_RX_COMP_MATRIX_I_CONFIG[0]
register.comment: This register controls the receiver IQ matrix compensation parameters for output I samples.

register.name: DFE_RX_COMP_MATRIX_Q_CONFIG[0]
register.comment: This register controls the receiver IQ matrix compensation parameters for output Q samples.

register.name: DFE_SIGANAL_CH0_I_OUTPUT[0]
register.comment: This contains the signed I value generated by channel 0 of the signal analyser

register.name: DFE_SIGANAL_CH0_Q_OUTPUT[0]
register.comment: This contains the signed Q value generated by channel 1 of the signal analyser

register.name: DFE_SIGANAL_CH1_I_OUTPUT[0]
register.comment: This contains the signed I value generated by channel 1 of the signal analyser

register.name: DFE_SIGANAL_CH1_Q_OUTPUT[0]
register.comment: This contains the signed Q value generated by channel 1 of the signal analyser

register.name: DFE_SIGANAL_STATUS[0]
register.comment: Signal analyser status bits.

register.name: DFE_SIG_ENABLE

register.name: DFE_SIGGEN_CONFIG[0]
register.comment: Register to control operation of the internal signal generator. SigGen must be enabled in DFE_SIGGEN_ENABLE to start

register.name: DFE_SIGGEN_CONFIG2[0]

register.name: DFE_SIGGEN_FREQ1[0]
register.comment: This sets the frequency of the primary (only) tone used by the signal generator. The value for a given frequency can be found by multiplying by 65 536 and dividing by the sample rate of the injection point. (The sample rate is currently 160Msps for TX and 320Msps for RX).

register.name: DFE_SIGGEN_FREQ2[0]
register.comment: This sets the frequency of the secondary tone used by the signal generator. The value for a given frequency can be found by multiplying by 65 536 and dividing by the sample rate of the injection point (The sample rate is currently 160Msps for TX and 320Msps for RX).

register.name: DFE_SIGGEN_PHASE[0]
register.comment: This register has two functions: it is the value preloaded into the accumulator used to generate the first tone, so can set the phase of that tone relative to the second tone or the signal analyser tone. Also, it is used to provide the DC level in that mode of operation

register.name: DFE_TX_COMP_HP_OFFSET_CONFIG[0]

register.name: BB_TX_PACK_SCAN_CONFIG_STATUS_I0

register.name: BB_TX_PACK_PLEN_1_STATUS_I0
register.comment: For Hiperlan2: The number of OFDM symbols in the first data part of the packet. For 802.11a: bit 0 is bit 10 of N_data, where N_data is the number of OFDM symbols in the 'Data' part of the burst. Bits [8:1] contain the number of bits transmitted in the last OFDM symbol, including the 6 tail bits. For 802.11n non-STBC: bits [10:0] contain the number of bits transmitted in the last OFDM symbol, including the 6 tail bits. For 802.11n STBC: bits [10:0] contain the number of bits transmitted in the last pair of OFDM symbols, including the 6 tail bits.

register.name: BB_TX_PACK_PLEN_2_STATUS_I0
register.comment: For Hiperlan 2: The number of OFDM symbols in the second data part of the packet. For 802.11a: Bits [9:0] contain bits [9:0] of N_data. For 802.11n: Bits [14:0] contain [bits [14:0] of] N_data. Bit 15 indicates LDPC Extra OFDM symbol.

register.name: BB_TX_PACK_P1_START_I0
register.comment: Bit 0 is one if the first data part of the packet has P1 puncturing, else is zero. Bit 1 is one if the second data part of the packet has P1 puncturing, else is zero. 11a/n does not use P1 puncturing.

register.name: BB_TX_PACK_CRC_TYPE_I0
register.comment: Bit 0 indicates the CRC type for the first data part of the burst (0 = CRC16, 1 = CRC24). Bit 1 indicates the CRC type for the second data part of the burst

register.name: BB_TX_PACK_CRC_PERIOD_STATUS_I0
register.comment: For Hiperlan2: The CRC period i.e. the number of bytes over which the CRC is computed within each of the data parts of the packet. Bits [5:0] are the CRC period for the first data part of the packet, bits [11:6] are the CRC period for the second part. For 802.11a and 802.11n: The number of bytes of the payload, including the four CRC32 bytes.

register.name: BB_TX_PACK_CRC_N_PERIODS_I0
register.comment: The number of CRC periods in each part of the packet. Bits [7:0] - the number of CRC periods in the first part of the packet. Bits [15:8] - the number of CRC periods in the second part of the packet.

register.name: BB_TX_WARMUP_I0
register.comment: The TX warmup time, in units of 400 ns.

register.name: BB_TX_INT_MASK_I0
register.comment: Interrupt mask register. Setting a bit in this register against an interrupt cause bit position, ensures that it generates an interrupt.

register.name: BB_TX_INT_CAUSE_I0
register.comment: Interrupt cause register. Read by the host to determine why it was interrupted.

register.name: BB_TX_INT_CLEAR_I0
register.comment: Interrupt clear register. Writing a one to an interrupt cause bit position clears the associated bit in the BB_**_INT_CAUSE register.

register.name: BB_TX_TIMING_I0
register.comment: Tx timing adjust control to allow correction for TX latency

register.name: BB_TX_PACK_QUEUE_I0
register.comment: The number of packets queued for TX by the host and not yet completed.

register.name: BB_TX_SCRAMBLER_SEED_I0
register.comment: Scrambler seed for transmitted bursts. If this register is set to zero, then a pseudo-random scrambler seed is automatically generated for every transmit burst. If this register is set to a non-zero value, then that value is used as the scrambler seed for transmitted bursts.

register.name: BB_TX_SGEN_START_I0
register.comment: Configurable SgenStart (in 6.25ns steps).

register.name: BB_BBA_BF_TX_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: TX beamforming configuration.

register.name: BB_BBA_BF_TX_KEYHOLE_I0
register.comment: TX beamforming configuration #2.

register.name: BB_BBA_BF_TX_STATUS1_I0
register.comment: Tx beamformer CBR category fields parsed.

register.name: BB_BBA_BF_TX_STATUS2_I0
register.comment: Tx beamformer fields parsed and DMA collision counter.

register.name: BB_BBA_BF_TX_ANGLE_STORE_KEYHOLE_DATA_STATUS_I0

register.name: BASEBAND_TX_CONFIG2_I0
register.comment: Config for Tx filtering stages and papr

register.name: BASEBAND_TX_EVM_PARAMS_I0

register.name: BB_TX_SWED_PAPR_CONFIG_I0

register.name: BB_LEG_DUP_DET_CONFIG_I0

register.name: BB_RX_INT_MASK_I0
register.comment: Interrupt mask register. Setting a bit in this register against an interrupt cause bit position, ensures that it generates an interrupt.

register.name: BB_RX_INT_CAUSE_I0
register.comment: Interrupt cause register. Read by the host to determine why it was interrupted.

register.name: BB_RX_INT_CLEAR_I0
register.comment: Interrupt clear register. Writing a one to an interrupt cause bit position clears the associated bit in the BB_**_INT_CAUSE register.

register.name: BB_RX_PACK_QUEUE_I0
register.comment: The number of packets queued for RX by the host and not yet completed.

register.comment: Receiver configuration

register.comment: Receiver configuration

register.name: BB_FTTRACK_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: Frequnecy and time offset configuration

register.name: BB_RX_DEMAP_METRIC_A_I0
register.comment: Demapper soft-decision metric as used by the Viterbi decoder

register.name: BB_RX_DEMAP_METRIC_B_I0
register.comment: Demapper soft-decision metric as used by the Viterbi decoder

register.name: BB_FREQ_OFFSET_I0
register.comment: Frequency offset for the last received burst

register.name: BB_SIGNAL_QUALITY_I0
register.comment: Bits 15:8 - The estimated EVM for the receive channel. Bits 7:0 - The estimated SNR, based on the burst preamble, for the receive channel

register.name: BB_SIGNAL_QUALITY_DUAL_I0
register.comment: Bits 15:8 - The estimated EVM for the dual receive channel. Bits 7:0 - The estimated SNR, based on the burst preamble, for the dual receive channel

register.name: BB_BBA_FREQ_OFFSET_MASK_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: Reduce the reliability of soft decsions on inner carriers (+/-1, +/-2) when estimated frequency offset exceeds certain thresholds OR permanently reduce the reliability on inner carriers regardless of frequency offset.

register.name: BB_BBA_FREQ_OFFSET_MASK_CFG_MA_SC_20M_I0
register.comment: Reduce the reliability of soft decision on the most affected subcarriers for 20/40MHz bandwidth(1 2 3 or -1 -2 -3, when offset frequency is positive,, it corresponds to -1 -2 and -3

register.name: BB_BBA_FREQ_OFFSET_MASK_CFG_LA_SC_20M_I0
register.comment: Reduce the reliability of soft decision on the less affected subcarriers for 20/40MHz bandwidth(1 2 3 or -1 -2 -3, when offset frequency is positive,, it corresponds to 1 2 and 3

register.name: BB_SOFT_WEIGH_FREQ_OFFSET_HIGH_THRESH_20M_40M_I0
register.comment: the high threshold value for frequency offset in soft weigh for 20/40MHz bandwidth, it is derived by 122 KHz/20 MHz * 2^16

register.name: BB_SOFT_WEIGH_FREQ_OFFSET_LOW_THRESH_20M_40M_I0
register.comment: the low threshold value for frequency offset in soft weigh for 20/40MHz bandwidth, it is derived by 50 KHz/20 MHz * 2^16

register.name: BB_SOFT_WEIGH_FREQ_OFFSET_HIGH_THRESH_10M_I0
register.comment: the high threshold value for frequency offset in soft weigh for 10MHz bandwidth, it is derived by 84 KHz/10 MHz * 2^16

register.name: BB_SOFT_WEIGH_FREQ_OFFSET_LOW_THRESH_10M_I0
register.comment: the low threshold value for frequency offset in soft weigh for 10MHz bandwidth, it is derived by 14 KHz/10 MHz * 2^16

register.name: BB_SOFT_WEIGH_FREQ_OFFSET_HIGH_THRESH_5M_I0
register.comment: the high threshold value for frequency offset in soft weigh for 5MHz bandwidth, it is derived by 75 KHz/5 MHz * 2^16

register.name: BB_SOFT_WEIGH_FREQ_OFFSET_LOW_THRESH_5M_I0
register.comment: the low threshold value for frequency offset in soft weigh for 5MHz bandwidth, it is derived by 31KHz/5 MHz * 2^16

register.name: ENC_DMA_ENCR_TYPE_I0

register.comment: Encryption key length 128 or 256

register.comment: Frame body length in octets

register.comment: Frame header length in octets

register.name: ENC_DMA_ENC_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: Contains the following configuration bits:

register.name: ENC_DMA_PRIORITY_OCTET_I0
register.comment: Priority octet used in TKIP MIC calculation. Set to zero in this case. For CCMP operation, bits set to 1 in this octet will be set to one in the Nonce Flags Octet. It should be set to 0x10 for Management frames but should be set to 0xFF for Cisco CCX S67 compatibility; it must be set to 0x0 otherwise. (Refer to 802.11w section 8.3.3.3.3)

register.name: ENC_DMA_FC_MASK_I0
register.comment: Frame Control Mask. Determines which Frame Control bits are masked (i.e. included in the AAD calculation) in CCMP mode. Its default value is 0xC78F. (Refer to 802.11n section 8.3.3.3.2)

register.name: ENC_DMA_AAD_QC_MASK_I0
register.comment: Additional Authentication Data QoS Control field mask value for CCMP encryption. Set to 0x0F unless both the STA and its peer have their SPP A-MSDU Capable fields set to 1. In that case, set to 0x8F. (Refer to 802.11n section 8.3.3.3.2 g)

register.comment: Flags [Configuration bits] register 12.

register.name: MAC_RX_FILTER_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: RX filter configuration

register.name: MAC_MIN_MPDU_LEN_I0
register.comment: Minimum RX MPDU length. Received MPDUs shorter than this are discarded.

register.name: MAC_MAX_MPDU_LEN_I0
register.comment: Maximum RX MPDU length. Received MPDUs longer than this are discarded.

register.name: MAC_CCA_CFG_I0
register.comment: Configures CCA utilisation.

register.name: MAC_CTRL_RESPONSE_TX_LEVEL_I0
register.comment: Transmit level for control response frames.

register.name: MAC_CTRL_RESPONSE_TX_ANT_I0
register.comment: Transmit antenna configuration for control response frames.

register.name: MAC_AC_BK_TXOP_LIMIT_I0
register.comment: TXOP limit in units of 32 us for the AC_BK EDCA queue.

register.name: MAC_AC_BE_TXOP_LIMIT_I0
register.comment: TXOP limit in units of 32 us for the AC_BE EDCA queue.

register.name: MAC_AC_VI_TXOP_LIMIT_I0
register.comment: TXOP limit in units of 32 us for the AC_VI EDCA queue.

register.name: MAC_AC_VO_TXOP_LIMIT_I0
register.comment: TXOP limit in units of 32 us for the AC_VO EDCA queue.

register.name: MAC_TXOP_TIME_LEFT_I0
register.comment: The firmware can read from this register the time remaining in the current TXOP, in units of 1 us.

register.name: MAC_EIFS_I0
register.comment: Programmable EIFS

register.name: MAC_SLOT_TIME_US_I0
register.comment: Programmable slot time in us

register.name: MAC_NDP_MCS_I0
register.comment: Programs MCS used for HT NDP or VHT NDP transmission.

register.name: MAC_BFER_CFG_I0
register.comment: Configures beamformer.

register.name: MAC_BFEE_CFG_I0
register.comment: Configures beamformee.

register.name: MAC_MCS_FEEDBACK_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: MCS feedback configuration

register.name: MAC_TID_QSIZE_MAP_I0
register.comment: Maps one of 16 TIDs to one of four queue sizes, for the purpose of setting the 'Queue Size' field in transmitted QoS frames.

register.name: MAC_TID_QSIZE_I0
register.comment: Queue sizes numbers 0, 1, 2 and 3.

register.name: MAC_M_NAV_END_I0
register.comment: The firmware can read from this register the NAV end time.

register.name: MAC_NAV_BSSID_BYTE3_0_I0
register.comment: The firmware can read from this register the BSSID associated to the current NAV.

register.name: MAC_TXOPHOLDER_BYTE3_0_I0
register.comment: The firmware can read from this register the TXOP holder associated to the current NAV.

register.name: MAC_NAV_SRC_I0
register.comment: NAV sources. See 802.11-1999 as amended in 802.11-2007.

register.name: MAC_TX_SIFS_REF_I0
register.comment: Adjust the timing of Data frame following a CTS-to-self. This is nominally the time between the on-air end of frame to the point when MAC issues PHY RX End signal. This is measured in 25 ns units.

register.name: MAC_TX_RIFS_REF_I0
register.comment: Adjust TX timing references to achieve RIFS transmission. This is 25 ns units.

register.name: MAC_RESPONSE_DELAY_SIFS_I0
register.comment: Bits 7 down to 0 are programmable time in 25ns units to delay response frames such that SIFS is met. Bit 8 allows timing at the end of HT-MM short GI frames to be measured on 4us symbol boundaries. This affects SIFS timing of short GI frames.

register.name: MAC_TXEND_LATENCY_I0
register.comment: The time between the modem sending a 'TX End' signal to the actual on-air end of frame. This is measured in 25 ns units. This is used as an 'off-air' indicator.

register.name: MAC_CSTATE_IFS_ADJUST_I0
register.comment: Adjust IFS timing for in channel state module

register.name: MAC_PHYIF_SYMB_START_11B_I0
register.comment: Programmable time in 25ns units that adjusts the symbol start time in MAC_PHY_INTERFACE (+) for 11b. This adjusts the position of the PHY preamble.

register.name: MAC_PHYIF_SYMB_END_11B_I0
register.comment: Programmable time that adjust 11b RX latency to meet SIFS. The format is 4.6 unsigned. The integer part is in microseconds. The fractional part is in 25 ns.

register.name: MAC_PHYIF_SYMB_START_ADJUST_I0
register.comment: Programmable time in 25ns units that adjusts the symbol start time in MAC_PHY_INTERFACE (+/-) for OFDM.

register.name: MAC_PHYIF_SYMB_END_ADJUST_I0
register.comment: Programmable time in 25ns units that adjusts the symbol end time in MAC_PHY_INTERFACE (+/-) for OFDM.

register.name: MAC_PHYIF_STBC_WITH_LDPC_SYMB_END_ADJUST_I0
register.comment: Programmable time in 25ns units that adjusts the symbol end time in MAC_PHY_INTERFACE for a received frame containing both STBC and LDPC (+/-) for OFDM.

register.name: MAC_PHYIF_STBC_LDPC_SYMB_END_ADJUST_I0
register.comment: Programmable time in 25us units that adjusts the symbol end time in MAC_PHY_INTERFACE for STBC or LDPC reception (+/-) for OFDM.

register.name: MAC_PHYIF_RXSTART_ADJUST_I0
register.comment: Programmable time in 1us unit that adjusts the RX_START start time in MAC_PHY_INTERFACE.

register.name: MAC_TX_CTSRESPONSE_ADJUST_I0
register.comment: Programmable time in 25ns units that adjusts the start of the TX of the frame sent at SIFS after a CTS TX or RX.

register.name: MAC_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT_11A_I0
register.comment: Programmable time in us that the MAC waits for a response in 11a.

register.name: MAC_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT_11B_I0
register.comment: Programmable time in us that the MAC waits for a response in 11b.

register.name: MAC_RX_AMPDU_CFG_I0
register.comment: Receive A-MPDU configuration.

register.name: MAC_SEC_CHAN_CLEAR_TIME_I0
register.comment: Secondary Channel must be free for this amount of time (50ns unit) before it is declared non-busy for starting a Txop.

register.name: MAC_SEC_CHAN_CLEAR_TIME_CTS_I0
register.comment: The bottom 10 bits means secondary channel must be free for this amount of time (50ns unit) before it is declared non-busy for CTS response to a RTS signalling TA. Bits [13:10] is a signed number that adjusts the delay between the start of frame and the synchronisation start pulse from the modem.

register.name: MAC_TX_DELAY_FINE_TUNE_I0
register.comment: Transmit delay fine tune. Provides fine adjustment of inter-frame spacing.

register.name: MAC_CS_LATENCY_I0
register.comment: CS latency in units of 25 ns: time that medium is still marked busy after CS becomes inactive. The purpose of this is to stretch CCA status from CS latency to nominal OFDM RX latency.

register.name: MAC_RADIO_SYNC_LATENCY_I0
register.comment: Radio sync latency in units of 25 ns: time that medium is still marked busy after CS becomes inactive. The purpose of this is to cover the time between modem indicates CCA busy to the start of packet pulse.

register.name: MAC_MODEM_SYNC_LATENCY_I0
register.comment: Modem sync latency in units of 25 ns: time that medium is still marked busy after CS becomes inactive. The purpose of this is to cover the time between OFDM STF sync to the start of packet pulse.

register.name: MAC_DEFAULT_AMPDU_DURATION_I0
register.comment: This is the duration of an A-MPDU frame exchange when it is the next frame from the frame at the head of a queue.

register.name: MAC_MAX_ACK_DURATION_I0
register.comment: Maximum ACK duration for DSSS/CCK and OFDM.

register.name: MAC_DOT11_FCS_ERROR_COUNT_I0
register.comment: Received frame FCS error counter.

register.name: MAC_DOT11_FCS_GOOD_COUNT_I0
register.comment: Received frame FCS good counter.

register.name: MAC_DOT11_ERROR_COUNT_I0
register.comment: Received frame error counter that is NOT a FCS error.

register.name: MAC_BAD_SIG_COUNT_I0
register.comment: Received frame bad signal counter.

register.name: MAC_TX_UNDER_COUNT_I0
register.comment: TX frames which were corrupted by the accelerator due to TX underflow.

register.name: MAC_RX_VHT_MU_UNMATCHED_GID_I0
register.comment: VHT MU frames where GID does not match.

register.name: MAC_AC_BK_TIME_SPENT_I0
register.comment: This register counts the time spent transmitting from the AC_BK queue, in units of 16 us.

register.name: MAC_DOT11_RX_OCTETS_IN_AMPDUS_I0
register.comment: Counts of the number of octets received in AMPDUs.

register.name: MAC_DOT11_RX_AMPDUS_COUNT_I0
register.comment: Counts of the number of received AMPDUs.

register.name: MAC_DOT11_RX_MPDUS_IN_AMPDUS_COUNT_I0
register.comment: Counts of the number of MPDUs received in AMPDUs.

register.name: MAC_DOT11_RX_AMPDU_DELIM_LEN_ERR_COUNT_I0
register.comment: Counts the number of length errors in MPDU delimiters found in received AMPDUs.

register.name: MAC_DOT11_RX_AMPDU_DELIM_SPACING_ERR_COUNT_I0
register.comment: Counts the number of start spacing errors in MPDU delimiters found in received AMPDUs.

register.name: MAC_DOT11_RX_AMPDU_DELIM_SINGLE_ERR_COUNT_I0
register.comment: Counts the number of VHT single errors in MPDU delimiters found in received AMPDUs.

register.name: MAC_AC_BE_TIME_SPENT_I0
register.comment: This register counts the time spent transmitting from the AC_BE queue, in units of 16 us.

register.name: MAC_AC_VI_TIME_SPENT_I0
register.comment: This register counts the time spent transmitting from the AC_VI queue, in units of 16 us.

register.name: MAC_AC_VO_TIME_SPENT_I0
register.comment: This register counts the time spent transmitting from the AC_VO queue, in units of 16 us.

register.name: MAC_AC_CBR_TIME_SPENT_I0
register.comment: This register counts the time spent transmitting from the AC_CBR queue, in units of 16 us.

register.name: MAC_TXRX_TIME_SPENT_I0
register.comment: This register counts the time spent transmitting and receiving, in units of 16 us.

register.name: MAC_CCA_BUSY_TIME_I0
register.comment: This register counts the time CCA indicates busy, in units of 16 us.

register.name: MAC_SEC_BUSY_TIME_I0
register.comment: This register counts the time secondary channel is busy, in units of 16 us.

register.name: MAC_SEC40_BUSY_TIME_I0
register.comment: This register counts the time secondary40 channel is busy, in units of 16 us.

register.name: MAC_SEC80_BUSY_TIME_I0
register.comment: This register counts the time secondary80 channel is busy, in units of 16 us.

register.name: MAC_IF_RX_BUFFER_START_I0
register.comment: Address of start of Receive Buffer. Multiple of 1k. Address = MAC_IF_RX_BUFFER_START*1024. Since MAC IF is connected 'directly' to RAMSW, value of 0x00_0000 => start of RAMSW

register.name: MAC_IF_RX_BUFFER_SIZE_I0
register.comment: Size of Receive Buffer. Units of 1k bytes. Offset of 1k bytes. 0 => 1k bytes, 1 => 2k bytes, 63 => 64k bytes

register.name: MAC_IF_RX_BUFFER_GIVE_I0
register.comment: Receive Buffer Write Pointer (updated only at Receive Dollop boundaries)

register.name: MAC_IF_RX_BUFFER_TAKE_I0
register.comment: Receive Buffer Read Pointer

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER0_START_I0
register.comment: Address of start of Transmit Buffer 0. Multiple of 1k. Address = MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER0_START*1024. Since MAC IF is connected 'directly' to RAMSW, value of 0x00_0000 => start of RAMSW

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER0_SIZE_I0
register.comment: Size of Transmit Buffer 0. Units of 1k bytes. Offset of 1k bytes. 0 => 1k bytes, 1 => 2k bytes, 63 => 64k bytes

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER0_GIVE_I0
register.comment: Transmit Buffer 0 Write Pointer

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER0_SPACE_I0
register.comment: Number of bytes of free space in Transmit Buffer 0. Two lsb always 0. Note that when a MAC frame is transmitted using RTS/CTS protection, then the MAC ACC will rewind the Transmit Buffer Read Pointer by four words. Thus the value in this register may be sixteen greater than the space actually available

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER0_TRIGGER_I0
register.comment: Generate interrupt when free space in Transmit Buffer 0 is greater than or equal to this number. Two lsb ignored and treated as 0

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER1_START_I0
register.comment: Address of start of Transmit Buffer 1. Multiple of 1k. Address = MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER1_START*1024. Since MAC IF is connected 'directly' to RAMSW, value of 0x00_0000 => start of RAMSW

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER1_SIZE_I0
register.comment: Size of Transmit Buffer 1. Units of 1k bytes. Offset of 1k bytes. 0 => 1k bytes, 1 => 2k bytes, 63 => 64k bytes

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER1_GIVE_I0
register.comment: Transmit Buffer 1 Write Pointer

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER1_SPACE_I0
register.comment: Number of bytes of free space in Transmit Buffer 1. Two lsb always 0. Note that when a MAC frame is transmitted using RTS/CTS protection, then the MAC ACC will rewind the Transmit Buffer Read Pointer by four words. Thus the value in this register may be sixteen greater than the space actually available

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER1_TRIGGER_I0
register.comment: Generate interrupt when free space in Transmit Buffer 1 is greater than or equal to this number. Two lsb ignored and treated as 0

register.name: MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_RAW_STATUS_I0
register.comment: Interrupt Raw Status register. This is a 'sticky' register. The (transient) interrupt sources can (only) set the bits to 1. Bits may be cleared to 0 by writing to MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_CLEAR. When the MAC IF is Disabled, the interrupt sources are prevented from updating INTERRUPT_RAW_STATUS

register.name: MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_STATUS_I0
register.comment: Interrupt Status register. Value in this register is MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_RAW_STATUS ANDed with MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_ENABLE. If one or more of the bits in this register are 1, then the interrupt output signal from the MAC IF will be asserted

register.name: MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_ENABLE_I0
register.comment: Interrupt Enable register. Allows the various interrupt sources to be enabled / masked. If masked (i.e. a bit is a 0), then the interrupt source will not cause an interrupt, but the source may still be polled via MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_RAW_STATUS

register.name: MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_CLEAR_I0
register.comment: Interrupt Clear register. Writing a 1 to a bit will clear (set to 0) the corresponding bit in MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_RAW_STATUS. Writing a 0 has no effect. The clear only lasts for one clock cycle; there is no need to write a 0 after writing a 1

register.name: MAC_IF_DEBUG_SELECT_I0
register.comment: Debug Select

register.name: MAC_IF_DEBUG_STATUS_I0
register.comment: Debug Status

register.name: WL_RADIO_CONFIG
register.comment: Miscellaneous config bits

register.name: WL_RADIO_TEMP_CTRL_CONFIG
register.comment: Control register for block interfacing to analogue temperature sensor

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_MIMO_CONFIG
register.comment: Select the AGC strategy for MIMO

register.name: WL_RADIO_CLOCK_CONTROL
register.comment: Enable/disable Radio Clocks

register.name: WL_RADIO_MISC
register.comment: This register reserved for miscellaneous tasks.

register.name: WL_RADIO_RX_COMP_AUTO_COEFFS_I0
register.comment: The current values of automatic I/Q trims can be read back from this register. The trim values are in sign/magnitude format. The phase trim is in the upper 8 bits and the amplitude trim in the lower 8 bits of this register. By setting the WL_RADIO_RX_COMP_LUT_READ_EN bit in the WL_RADIO_RX_COMP_CONFIG1 register, entries in the compensation table can also be read.

register.name: WL_RADIO_RX_PHASE_COMP_LUT_STATUS_I0
register.comment: This register reads the current phase compensation LUT entry

register.name: WL_RADIO_RX_AMPL_COMP_LUT_STATUS_I0
register.comment: This register reads the current amplitude compensation LUT entry

register.name: WL_RADIO_DIG_GAIN_STATUS_I0
register.comment: This register contains the current gain settings to all digital blocks in the receive chain

register.name: WL_RADIO_CHANNEL_STATUS_I0
register.comment: This register contains the instantaneous value of the RSSI, CCA and CS of this receive chain

register.name: WL_RADIO_INT_CLEAR_I0
register.comment: Writing this register clears any interrupts whose corresponding bits are set in the write data. Bit allocations are as for WL_RADIO_INT_MASK.

register.name: WL_RADIO_INT_MASK_I0
register.comment: This register masks events from causing interrupts. Only those interrupts whose mask bit is set will be delivered to the processors

register.name: WL_RADIO_INT_STATUS_I0
register.comment: This register has bits set in it for any interrupt that is currently active. Bits are set for any active interrupt, whether it is masked or not

register.name: WL_RADIO_INT_STATUS_RAW_I0
register.comment: This register has bits set in it for any interrupt that is currently active. Bits are set for any active interrupt, whether it is masked or not

register.name: WL_RADIO_RF_INT_STATUS_RAW_I0

register.name: WL_RADIO_RF_INTS_I0
register.comment: This register has bits set in it for any interrupt that is currently active. Bits are set for any active interrupt, whether it is masked or not

register.name: WL_SPEEDY_INT_ENABLE_I0

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG1_I0
register.comment: Miscellaneous config bits for the AGC as follows:

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG2_I0
register.comment: Configuration bits for the AGC: initial gain settings before first update comes from RF chip

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG3_I0
register.comment: Configuration bits for the AGC: digital gain range definition. Also initial baseband gain until first update arrives from RF chip

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG4_I0
register.comment: Further configuration bits for the AGC: digital gain settings

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG5_I0
register.comment: Further configuration bits for the AGC: clipping detection behaviour

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG6_I0
register.comment: Further configuration bits for the AGC: ADC signal size nudge up thresholds

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG7_I0
register.comment: Further configuration bits for the AGC: ADC signal size nudge up thresholds

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG9_I0
register.comment: Further configuration bits for the AGC: ADC signal size nudge up thresholds

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG10_I0
register.comment: Further configuration bits for the AGC: ADC signal size nudge up thresholds

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG11_I0
register.comment: Further configuration bits for the AGC: ADC signal size nudge up thresholds

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_TIMEOUT_I0
register.comment: This register specifies programmable timeouts for the AGC

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_DIG_RSSI_TIME_I0
register.comment: This register specifies programmable configurations to measure digital RSSI for different purposes

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_DIG_RSSI_TIME2_I0
register.comment: This register specifies programmable configurations to measure digital RSSI for different purposes

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_OFDM_RSSI_TARGET_I0
register.comment: This register specifies the RSSI target for an OFDM receive burst after decimation.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CCK_RSSI_TARGET_I0
register.comment: This register specifies the RSSI target for a CCK receive burst after decimation.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_OFDM_RSSI_TARGET_DELTA_I0
register.comment: This register specifies the RSSI steps of (Maximum target + 2X dB) and (Minimum target - 2X dB) for a OFDM receive. Where X can be 1.5 dB or 2 dB depending on WL_RADIO_AGC_MIN_GAIN_STEP_SIZE.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CCK_RSSI_TARGET_DELTA_I0
register.comment: This register specifies the RSSI steps of (Maximum target + 2X dB) and (Minimum target - 2X dB) for a CCK receive. Where X can be 1.5 dB or 2 dB depending on WL_RADIO_AGC_MIN_GAIN_STEP_SIZE.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CS_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: This register configures the carrier sense. It is asserted when analogue gain is less than a threshold and digital RSSI is greater than a threshold. The thresholds are set in this register

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_FE_INDEX_LUT0_I0
register.comment: LUT for conversion of FE gain to LNA and Mixer gain and vice versa.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_FE_INDEX_LUT1_I0
register.comment: LUT for conversion of FE gain to LNA and Mixer gain and vice versa.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_FE_GAIN_LUT0_I0
register.comment: LUT for calculating the gain applied by each FE gain index in unsigned 0.25 db for format.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_FE_GAIN_LUT1_I0
register.comment: LUT for calculating the gain applied by each FE gain index in unsigned 0.25 db for format.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_FE_GAIN_LUT2_I0
register.comment: LUT for calculating the gain applied by each FE gain index in unsigned 0.25 db for format.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_BB_GAIN_LUT0_I0
register.comment: LUT for calculating the gain applied by each analogue baseband gain index in unsigned 0.25 db for format.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_BB_GAIN_LUT1_I0
register.comment: LUT for calculating the gain applied by each analogue baseband gain index in unsigned 0.25 db for format.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_BB_GAIN_LUT2_I0
register.comment: LUT for calculating the gain applied by each analogue baseband gain index in unsigned 0.25 db for format.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_EXT_LNA_GAIN_LUT_I0
register.comment: LUT for calculating the gain applied by each external LNA gain index in unsigned 0.25 db for format.

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: Coadj general config register

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_CONFIG2_I0
register.comment: Coadj general config register 2

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_STATUS_I0
register.comment: Coadj general status register

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_COMMS_I0
register.comment: General Communication register. Bracken gets an interrupt event when this is written

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_TIMER_I0
register.comment: Timer initial value, downcount at core clk rate starts on write

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_MEM_ADDR_I0
register.comment: Coadj Code/Data Mem Address. MSBs=2'b00: DataStore, 2'b10: Core internal regs, 2'b11: Local regs

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_MEM_WDATA_I0
register.comment: Coadj Code/Data Mem Write Data - auto increments address on write

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_MEM_RDATA_I0
register.comment: Coadj Code/Data Mem Read Data - auto increments address on read

register.name: WL_RADIO_ZIPPY_TO_RF_FLAGS_I0
register.comment: Zippy flag data (info and channel) to be sent to RFIC

register.name: WL_RADIO_ZIPPY_TO_BB_FILTER_I0
register.comment: Filter bitmap for Zippy channels that cause an interrupt to be raised on traffic to the BBIC

register.name: WL_RADIO_ZIPPY_TO_RF_CFG_I0
register.comment: Zippy channel configuration for SW data to the BBIC

register.name: WL_RADIO_ZIPPY_TO_BB_FLAGS_I0
register.comment: Zippy flag data to the BBIC, plus latched Valid and Ack

register.name: WL_DEBUG_SEL
register.comment: Select for WLan_pd level debug mux

register.name: WL_DEBUG_STATUS
register.comment: Debug data at WLan_pd level

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_POSN_3_0
register.comment: Select for WLan_pd level debug mux

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_POSN_7_4
register.comment: Select for WLan_pd level debug mux

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_POSN_11_8
register.comment: Select for WLan_pd level debug mux

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_POSN_15_12
register.comment: Select for WLan_pd level debug mux

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_BUS_0_SEL
register.comment: Source bus select for intermediate bus 0 (select one of up to 32 busses)

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_BUS_1_SEL
register.comment: Source bus select for intermediate bus 1 (select one of up to 32 busses)

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_BUS_2_SEL
register.comment: Source bus select for intermediate bus 2 (select one of up to 32 busses)

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_BUS_3_SEL
register.comment: Source bus select for intermediate bus 3 (select one of up to 32 busses)

register.name: WL_SPEEDY_ADDR_CTRL_I0
register.comment: Address and control flags for a Speedy transaction. Write this register to create an APB cycle on the remote chip (set up the write data first for write cycles)

register.name: WL_SPEEDY_WRITE_DATA_I0
register.comment: Data to write to APB over Speedy

register.name: WL_SPEEDY_READ_DATA_I0
register.comment: Data read back for APB over Speedy

register.name: WL_SPEEDY_APB_STATUS_I0
register.comment: Status of the current APB cycle

register.name: WL_SPEEDY_ERROR_RECOVERY_I0
register.comment: Write this register to clear a timeout or APB access error that has been triggered by an earlier cycle

block.name: zippy_bb
block.comment: ZIPPY BB control and status registers

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_ADDR_CTRL
register.comment: ZIPPY remote register access address and controls. The bottom 16 bits of this register (PSEL and ADDR) are actually the bottom 16 bits of the byte address of the RFIC register to be accessed (from HTML docs for example)

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WRITE_DATA
register.comment: Data to write to remote register over ZIPPY. Only the number of bytes specified in the ZIPPY_BB_WIDTH field are transferred. Unwritten bytes are unchanged, if the destination register is larger than the number of bytes written

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_READ_DATA
register.comment: Data returned from the remote register over ZIPPY. Only the number of bytes specified in the ZIPPY_BB_WIDTH field are transferred

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_TIMEOUTS
register.comment: Time out control for register read data and write acknowledges (if enabled) to be returned from the RF IC

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_TRANSPORT
register.comment: ZIPPY baseband transport configuration. The matching configuration must also be set up in the RF chip

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_PRIORITY_INC_RATE
register.comment: Configure the rate at which priority increases for unserviced channels.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_FLAGS0_CFG
register.comment: Type 0 (BT) flag frame configuration

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_FLAGS1_CFG
register.comment: Type 1 (BT) flag frame configuration

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_FLAGS2_CFG
register.comment: Type 2 (BT) flag frame configuration

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_FLAGS3_CFG
register.comment: Type 3 (WLAN) flag frame configuration

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_FLAGS4_CFG
register.comment: Type 4 (WLAN) flag frame configuration

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_FLAGS5_CFG
register.comment: Type 5 (WLAN) flag frame configuration

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_DATA_CFG
register.comment: Address/data frame configuration and write ack mask

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_EN
register.comment: Interrupt sources enable.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_STATUS
register.comment: Status of Interrupt sources.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_INT_CLEAR
register.comment: Clear Interrupt Sources by writing a 1 to the register bit.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_APB_STATUS
register.comment: Status of the RF IC register access

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_DATA_COUNTS
register.comment: Local BB counters for data from BB to RF and RF to BB. TO be compared with equivalent ones in the RFIC

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_DEBUG_CTRL
register.comment: Control of Zippy debug and logging facilities

register.name: ZIPPY_MUTEX
register.comment: Single resource mutual exclusion lock.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_TIMER_0
register.comment: Sets the window count down timer (in clock ticks).

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_PRE_RESV_0
register.comment: Sets the window Start of the Pre-Reservation window.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_RESV_0
register.comment: Sets the window Start of the Reservation window.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_TIMER_1
register.comment: Sets the window count down timer (in clock ticks).

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_PRE_RESV_1
register.comment: Sets the window Start of the Pre-Reservation window.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_WINDOW_RESV_1
register.comment: Sets the window Start of the Reservation window.

register.name: ZIPPY_BB_DATA_CFG2
register.comment: Sets the elevated REGS priority,
